perturbation.original_text: 1.1 The following words shall have the following meanings throughout this Agreement:                 a)    "Agreement" means this Agreement and all Schedules annexed hereto,            as amended from time to time by the Parties;
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 The following words shall have the following meanings throughout this document:                 a)    "Agreement" means this agreement and all Schedules annexed hereto,            as amended from time to time by the Parties;
perturbation.explanation: Using “Agreement” in the definition in one instance and “document” in another creates ambiguity whether the terms are interchangeable.

perturbation.original_text: 3.4     Each Party agrees to provide the services outlined above at an on time         performance level of no less than ninety percent (90%) of the scheduled         delivery time, excluding delays caused by the other Party or events of          Force Majeure. Monthly, the performance level shall be measured as set          out above. Failure to provide services as set out herein constitutes a          Monthly Service Failure.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.4     Each Party agrees to provide the services outlined above at an on time         performance level of no less than ninety percent (90%) of the scheduled         delivery time, excluding delays caused by the other Party or events of          Force Majeure. Monthly, the performance level shall be measured as set          out above. Failure to provide services as set out herein constitutes a          Monthly Operational Deficiency.
perturbation.explanation: Changing “Monthly Service Failure” to “Monthly Operational Deficiency” introduces a new, undefined term, creating uncertainty about how performance failures are defined and what their consequences are.

perturbation.original_text: 6.1    A Party shall be liable to the other for loss, damage or delay to Freight due to its acts or omissions, including its negligence, and those of its employees, agents and those for whom in law it is responsible and occurring while Freight is in its care, custody or control. For the purpose of this Agreement, Freight shall be considered        in the care, custody or control of a Party from the time it is tendered        to it by the other Party or the other Party's customer until the time of        its delivery to the other Party or the consignee, as intended.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1    A Party shall be liable to the other for loss, damage or delay to goods due to its acts or omissions, including its negligence, and those of its employees, agents and those for whom in law it is responsible and occurring while goods is in its care, custody or control. For the purpose of this Agreement, Freight shall be considered        in the care, custody or control of a Party from the time it is tendered        to it by the other Party or the other Party's customer until the time of        its delivery to the other Party or the consignee, as intended.
perturbation.explanation: Using “Freight” and then “goods” introduces ambiguity and it is unclear whether the terms are interchangeable throughout the contract, which creates uncertainty as to what exactly is covered for liability.
